page.title: 19HOUSING IN WICKHAM MARKET
page.content: The oldest housing in Wickham dates from the middle ages whilst the newest were built in the 80's. There are medieval stud and plaster cottages, Georgian and Victorian town houses and terraces and modern pre and post war estates. Many of the children live in the new housing at Simon Cross and those along Broad road. Orchard Place, Lime Close, Elm road beside the school where built in the 60's. All of these houses have main drainage, electricity, water and gas from the North Sea. But it is only a few years ago that the sewerage works was built in Wickham. Carolyn lives at 1 Lime Close and her house has got four bedrooms, two WC's, one bathroom, a playroom, a frontroom, kitchen, dining room and a garage. She has a front, back and side garden and says her house is big.
